title: Introduction to geoidep
text: package aims provide R users new way accessing official Peruvian cartographic data various topics managed countryâ€™s Spatial Data Infrastructure. offering new approach accessing official data, technical-scientific entities regional local governments, facilitates automation processes, thereby optimizing analysis use geospatial information across various fields.

title: Introduction to geoidep
text: Also, can install development version follows:
code: install.packages("geoidep") install.packages('pak') pak::pkg_install('ambarja/geoidep') library(geoidep) #>  #> â”€â”€ Welcome to geoidep â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€ #> â„¹ geoidep is a wrapper that allows you to download cartographic data for Peru from R. #> Currently, `geoidep` supports the following providers: #> âœ” Geobosque #> âœ” INEI #> âœ” Midagri #> âœ” Sernanp #> â„¹ For more information, please use the `get_data_sources()` function.

title: Introduction to geoidep
code: providers <- get_data_sources() providers #> # A tibble: 73 Ã— 7 #>    provider  category      layer       layer_can_be_actived admin_en year  link  #>    <chr>     <chr>         <chr>       <lgl>                <chr>    <chr> <chr> #>  1 INEI      General       departamenâ€¦ TRUE                 Nationaâ€¦ 2019  httpâ€¦ #>  2 INEI      General       provincia   TRUE                 Nationaâ€¦ 2019  httpâ€¦ #>  3 INEI      General       distritos   TRUE                 Nationaâ€¦ 2019  httpâ€¦ #>  4 Midagri   Agriculture   vegetationâ€¦ TRUE                 Ministrâ€¦ 2018  httpâ€¦ #>  5 Midagri   Agriculture   agriculturâ€¦ TRUE                 Ministrâ€¦ 2024  httpâ€¦ #>  6 Midagri   Agriculture   oil_palm_aâ€¦ TRUE                 Ministrâ€¦ 2016â€¦ httpâ€¦ #>  7 Midagri   Institucional experimentâ€¦ TRUE                 Ministrâ€¦ 2024  httpâ€¦ #>  8 Geobosque Forest        stock_bosqâ€¦ FALSE                Ministrâ€¦ 2001â€¦ httpâ€¦ #>  9 Geobosque Forest        stock_bosqâ€¦ TRUE                 Ministrâ€¦ 2001â€¦ httpâ€¦ #> 10 Geobosque Forest        stock_bosqâ€¦ TRUE                 Ministrâ€¦ 2001â€¦ httpâ€¦ #> # â„¹ 63 more rows layers_available <- get_providers() layers_available #> # A tibble: 4 Ã— 2 #>   provider  layer_count #>   <fct>           <int> #> 1 Geobosque           5 #> 2 INEI                3 #> 3 Midagri             4 #> 4 Sernanp            61

what: 4. Download Official Administrative Boundaries by INEI
title: Introduction to geoidep
code: # Region boundaries download  loreto_prov <- get_provinces(show_progress = FALSE) |>    subset(NOMBDEP == 'LORETO') # Display the first 10 rows of the data frame `departaments` head(loreto_prov) #> Simple feature collection with 6 features and 8 fields #> Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -77.82596 ymin: -6.14773 xmax: -69.94904 ymax: -0.03860597 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #>      id OBJECTID CCDD CCPP NOMBDEP                NOMBPROV SHAPE_Length #> 136 136      136   16   02  LORETO           ALTO AMAZONAS     9.955533 #> 137 137      137   16   07  LORETO       DATEM DEL MARAÃ‘ON    11.493679 #> 138 138      138   16   03  LORETO                  LORETO    13.602250 #> 139 139      139   16   04  LORETO MARISCAL RAMON CASTILLA    15.113580 #> 140 140      140   16   01  LORETO                  MAYNAS    14.501777 #> 141 141      141   16   08  LORETO                PUTUMAYO    20.443604 #>     SHAPE_Area                           geom #> 136   1.569481 MULTIPOLYGON (((-76.30752 -... #> 137   3.881998 MULTIPOLYGON (((-76.49832 -... #> 138   5.574816 MULTIPOLYGON (((-75.74592 -... #> 139   3.054652 MULTIPOLYGON (((-72.08996 -... #> 140   6.197942 MULTIPOLYGON (((-75.24086 -... #> 141   3.725588 MULTIPOLYGON (((-75.10004 -... # Defined Ubigeo  loreto_prov[["ubigeo"]] <- paste0(loreto_prov[["CCDD"]],loreto_prov[["CCPP"]]) loreto_prov #> Simple feature collection with 8 features and 9 fields #> Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -77.82596 ymin: -8.715191 xmax: -69.94904 ymax: -0.03860597 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #>      id OBJECTID CCDD CCPP NOMBDEP                NOMBPROV SHAPE_Length #> 136 136      136   16   02  LORETO           ALTO AMAZONAS     9.955533 #> 137 137      137   16   07  LORETO       DATEM DEL MARAÃ‘ON    11.493679 #> 138 138      138   16   03  LORETO                  LORETO    13.602250 #> 139 139      139   16   04  LORETO MARISCAL RAMON CASTILLA    15.113580 #> 140 140      140   16   01  LORETO                  MAYNAS    14.501777 #> 141 141      141   16   08  LORETO                PUTUMAYO    20.443604 #> 142 142      142   16   05  LORETO                 REQUENA    13.934825 #> 143 143      143   16   06  LORETO                 UCAYALI    10.879411 #>     SHAPE_Area                           geom ubigeo #> 136   1.569481 MULTIPOLYGON (((-76.30752 -...   1602 #> 137   3.881998 MULTIPOLYGON (((-76.49832 -...   1607 #> 138   5.574816 MULTIPOLYGON (((-75.74592 -...   1603 #> 139   3.054652 MULTIPOLYGON (((-72.08996 -...   1604 #> 140   6.197942 MULTIPOLYGON (((-75.24086 -...   1601 #> 141   3.725588 MULTIPOLYGON (((-75.10004 -...   1608 #> 142   4.113391 MULTIPOLYGON (((-73.42087 -...   1605 #> 143   2.432388 MULTIPOLYGON (((-74.82778 -...   1606

title: Introduction to geoidep
code: my_fun <- function(x){   data <- get_forest_loss_data(     layer = 'stock_bosque_perdida_provincia',     ubigeo = loreto_prov[["ubigeo"]][x],     show_progress = FALSE )   return(data) } historico_list <- lapply(X = 1:nrow(loreto_prov),FUN = my_fun) historico_df <- do.call(rbind.data.frame,historico_list) head(historico_df) #>   anio perdida rango1 rango2 rango3  rango4  rango5 tipobosque ubigeo #> 1 2001 2081.97      0   0.00  40.05  519.21 1522.71          1   1602 #> 2 2002 3923.46      0   0.00 136.71 1254.51 2532.24          1   1602 #> 3 2003 1843.92      0   0.00  23.94  584.73 1235.25          1   1602 #> 4 2004 4269.33      0   0.00 351.36 1818.00 2099.97          1   1602 #> 5 2005 4948.20      0   0.00 351.09 2020.50 2576.61          1   1602 #> 6 2006 2274.48      0 209.07 152.64  689.22 1223.55          1   1602

title: Introduction to geoidep
code: library(ggplot2) library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union historico_df |>    inner_join(y = loreto_prov,by = "ubigeo") |>    ggplot(aes(x = anio,y = perdida)) +    geom_point(size = 1) +    geom_line() +    facet_wrap(NOMBPROV~.,ncol = 3) +    theme_minimal(base_size = 5) +    labs(     title = "PÃ©rdida de bosque histÃ³rico del 2001-2023 \npara las provincias de Loreto",     caption = "Fuente: Geobosque",     x = "",     y = "")

title: Authors and Citation
text: antony barja. Author, maintainer, copyright holder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: barja (2024). geoidep: Download Geographic Data Various Topics Provided Managed Spatial Data Infrastructure Peru. R package version 0.1.0, https://geografo.pe/geoidep/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {geoidep: Download Geographic Data on Various Topics Provided and Managed by the Spatial Data Infrastructure of Peru},   author = {antony barja},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://geografo.pe/geoidep/}, }

what: Download Peruvian data managed by the Spatial Data Infrastructure (SDI) of the National Institute of Statistics and Informatics (INEI) of Peru
title: Download Peruvian data managed by the Spatial Data Infrastructure (SDI) of the National Institute of Statistics and Informatics (INEI) of Peru
text: goal geoidepðŸ“¦ offers R users easy accessible way obtain official cartographic data various topics, society ðŸ›ï¸, transportðŸš—, environmentðŸŒ±, agricultureðŸŒ¾, climateâ›…ï¸,among others. includes information provided regional government entities technical-scientific institutions, managed Spatial Data Infrastructure Peru.

title: Download Peruvian data managed by the Spatial Data Infrastructure (SDI) of the National Institute of Statistics and Informatics (INEI) of Peru
text: can install development version geoidep like : also official version available CRAN:
code: install.packages('pak') pak::pkg_install('ambarja/geoidep') install.packages('geoidep')

title: Download Peruvian data managed by the Spatial Data Infrastructure (SDI) of the National Institute of Statistics and Informatics (INEI) of Peru
text: example, can identify list providers available geoidep layers present. summary suppliers number available layers
code: library(geoidep) #>  #> â”€â”€ Welcome to geoidep â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€ #> â„¹ geoidep is a wrapper that allows you to download cartographic data for Peru from R. #> Currently, `geoidep` supports the following providers: #> âœ” Geobosque #> âœ” INEI #> âœ” Midagri #> âœ” Sernanp #> â„¹ For more information, please use the `get_data_sources()` function. get_data_sources() |>    head() #> # A tibble: 6 Ã— 7 #>   provider category    layer           layer_can_be_actived admin_en year  link  #>   <chr>    <chr>       <chr>           <lgl>                <chr>    <chr> <chr> #> 1 INEI     General     departamento    TRUE                 Nationaâ€¦ 2019  httpâ€¦ #> 2 INEI     General     provincia       TRUE                 Nationaâ€¦ 2019  httpâ€¦ #> 3 INEI     General     distritos       TRUE                 Nationaâ€¦ 2019  httpâ€¦ #> 4 Midagri  Agriculture vegetation_covâ€¦ TRUE                 Ministrâ€¦ 2018  httpâ€¦ #> 5 Midagri  Agriculture agriculture_seâ€¦ TRUE                 Ministrâ€¦ 2024  httpâ€¦ #> 6 Midagri  Agriculture oil_palm_areas  TRUE                 Ministrâ€¦ 2016â€¦ httpâ€¦ get_providers()  #> # A tibble: 4 Ã— 2 #>   provider  layer_count #>   <fct>           <int> #> 1 Geobosque           5 #> 2 INEI                3 #> 3 Midagri             4 #> 4 Sernanp            61

what: Example 02: Download official INEI administrative boundaries
title: Download Peruvian data managed by the Spatial Data Infrastructure (SDI) of the National Institute of Statistics and Informatics (INEI) of Peru
text: simple example download Peruâ€™s official administrative boundaries: first 10 rows original data displayed :
code: dep <- get_departaments(show_progress = FALSE) head(dep) #> Simple feature collection with 6 features and 6 fields #> Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -79.45857 ymin: -17.28501 xmax: -70.80408 ymax: -2.986125 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #>   id OBJECTID CCDD   NOMBDEP SHAPE_Length SHAPE_Area #> 1  1        1   01  AMAZONAS    13.059047   3.199147 #> 2  2        2   02    ANCASH    11.788249   2.954697 #> 3  3        3   03  APURIMAC     7.730154   1.765933 #> 4  4        4   04  AREQUIPA    17.459435   5.330125 #> 5  5        5   05  AYACUCHO    17.127166   3.643705 #> 6  6        6   06 CAJAMARCA    12.540288   2.688386 #>                             geom #> 1 MULTIPOLYGON (((-77.81399 -... #> 2 MULTIPOLYGON (((-77.64697 -... #> 3 MULTIPOLYGON (((-73.74655 -... #> 4 MULTIPOLYGON (((-71.98109 -... #> 5 MULTIPOLYGON (((-74.34843 -... #> 6 MULTIPOLYGON (((-78.70034 -...

title: Download Peruvian data managed by the Spatial Data Infrastructure (SDI) of the National Institute of Statistics and Informatics (INEI) of Peru
text: another example obtain historical forest loss data according given administrative boundary.
code: library(tidyverse) loreto <- dep |> filter(NOMBDEP == "LORETO") historico <- get_forest_loss_data(   layer = "stock_bosque_perdida_departamento",   ubigeo = loreto[["CCDD"]],   show_progress = FALSE) historico |>    ggplot(aes(x = anio,y = perdida )) +    geom_point(size = 2) +    geom_line(linewidth =1) +    theme_minimal() +    labs(     title = "PÃ©rdida de bosque del departamento de Loreto \ndurante los aÃ±os 2001 - 2023",     caption = "Fuente: Geobosque")

what: List providers, description, year and link â€” get_data_sources
title: List providers, description, year and link â€” get_data_sources

code: get_data_sources(query = NULL)

title: List providers, description, year and link â€” get_data_sources
text: query string. Default NULL. List available providers. details, use `get_providers` function.

text: tibble object.

code: # \donttest{ library(geoidep) get_data_sources() #> # A tibble: 73 Ã— 7 #>    provider  category      layer       layer_can_be_actived admin_en year  link  #>    <chr>     <chr>         <chr>       <lgl>                <chr>    <chr> <chr> #>  1 INEI      General       departamenâ€¦ TRUE                 Nationaâ€¦ 2019  httpâ€¦ #>  2 INEI      General       provincia   TRUE                 Nationaâ€¦ 2019  httpâ€¦ #>  3 INEI      General       distritos   TRUE                 Nationaâ€¦ 2019  httpâ€¦ #>  4 Midagri   Agriculture   vegetationâ€¦ TRUE                 Ministrâ€¦ 2018  httpâ€¦ #>  5 Midagri   Agriculture   agriculturâ€¦ TRUE                 Ministrâ€¦ 2024  httpâ€¦ #>  6 Midagri   Agriculture   oil_palm_aâ€¦ TRUE                 Ministrâ€¦ 2016â€¦ httpâ€¦ #>  7 Midagri   Institucional experimentâ€¦ TRUE                 Ministrâ€¦ 2024  httpâ€¦ #>  8 Geobosque Forest        stock_bosqâ€¦ FALSE                Ministrâ€¦ 2001â€¦ httpâ€¦ #>  9 Geobosque Forest        stock_bosqâ€¦ TRUE                 Ministrâ€¦ 2001â€¦ httpâ€¦ #> 10 Geobosque Forest        stock_bosqâ€¦ TRUE                 Ministrâ€¦ 2001â€¦ httpâ€¦ #> # â„¹ 63 more rows # }

what: Download INEI departmental boundaries â€” get_departaments
title: Download INEI departmental boundaries â€” get_departaments
text: function allows download latest version geometry ubigeos corresponding official political division departament boundaries Peru. information, can visit following page https://ide.inei.gob.pe/

title: Download INEI departmental boundaries â€” get_departaments
code: get_departaments(dsn = NULL, show_progress = TRUE, quiet = TRUE)

title: Download INEI departmental boundaries â€” get_departaments
text: dsn Character. Output filename. missing, temporary file created. show_progress Logical. Suppress bar progress. quiet Logical. Suppress info message.

title: Download INEI departmental boundaries â€” get_departaments
text: sf tibble object.

what: Download INEI district boundaries â€” get_districts
title: Download INEI district boundaries â€” get_districts
text: function allows download latest version geometry ubigeos corresponding official political division district boundaries Peru. information, can visit following page https://ide.inei.gob.pe/

title: Download INEI district boundaries â€” get_districts
code: get_districts(dsn = NULL, show_progress = TRUE, quiet = TRUE)

title: Download INEI district boundaries â€” get_districts
text: dsn Character. Output filename *.gpkg format. missing, temporary file created. show_progress Logical. Suppress bar progress. quiet Logical. Suppress info message.

title: Download INEI district boundaries â€” get_districts
text: sf object.

what: Download information on the latest deforestation alerts detected by Geobosque â€” get_early_warning
title: Download information on the latest deforestation alerts detected by Geobosque â€” get_early_warning
text: function allows download deforestation alert information detected Geobosque polygon located Peru. details, please visit following website: https://geobosques.minam.gob.pe

title: Download information on the latest deforestation alerts detected by Geobosque â€” get_early_warning
code: get_early_warning(region, sf = TRUE, show_progress = TRUE)

title: Download information on the latest deforestation alerts detected by Geobosque â€” get_early_warning
text: region string Specifies unique geographical code interest. sf Logical. Indicates whether return data `sf` object. show_progress Logical. TRUE, shows progress bar download.

title: Download information on the latest deforestation alerts detected by Geobosque â€” get_early_warning
text: tibble sf object, depending value `sf`.

title: Download information on the latest deforestation alerts detected by Geobosque â€” get_early_warning
code: # \donttest{ library(geoidep) amazonas <- get_departaments(show_progress = FALSE) |> subset(NOMBDEP == "AMAZONAS") warning_point <- get_early_warning(region = amazonas, sf = TRUE, show_progress = FALSE) head(warning_point) #> Simple feature collection with 6 features and 1 field #> Geometry type: POINT #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -78.11332 ymin: -4.87162 xmax: -78.06041 ymax: -4.869992 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #> # A tibble: 6 Ã— 2 #>   descrip                     geometry #>   <chr>                    <POINT [Â°]> #> 1 Warning points (-78.06068 -4.869992) #> 2 Warning points (-78.06041 -4.869992) #> 3 Warning points (-78.11332 -4.870535) #> 4 Warning points (-78.06339 -4.870806) #> 5 Warning points   (-78.0927 -4.87162) #> 6 Warning points  (-78.09243 -4.87162) # }

what: Download the forest and loss information from Geobosque â€” get_forest_loss_data
title: Download the forest and loss information from Geobosque â€” get_forest_loss_data
text: function allows download ubigeos corresponding official political division district, province region boundaries Peru forest loss information. information, can visit following website: https://geobosques.minam.gob.pe

title: Download the forest and loss information from Geobosque â€” get_forest_loss_data
code: get_forest_loss_data(layer = NULL, ubigeo = NULL, show_progress = TRUE)

title: Download the forest and loss information from Geobosque â€” get_forest_loss_data
text: layer string.Specifies one following available layers; stock_bosque_perdida_distrito, stock_bosque_perdida_provincia, stock_bosque_perdida_departamento. ubigeo string Specifies unique geographical code interest. show_progress Logical. Indicates whether display progress bar.

title: Download the forest and loss information from Geobosque â€” get_forest_loss_data
text: tibble object.

title: Download the forest and loss information from Geobosque â€” get_forest_loss_data
text: Available layers : stock_bosque_perdida_distrito: Returns data forest stock, forest loss, rank loss given district. stock_bosque_perdida_provincia: Returns data forest stock, forest loss, rank loss given province. stock_bosque_perdida_departamento: Returns data forest stock, forest loss, rank loss given region.

title: Download the forest and loss information from Geobosque â€” get_forest_loss_data
code: # \donttest{ library(geoidep) geobosque <- get_forest_loss_data(     layer = "stock_bosque_perdida_distrito",     ubigeo = "010101",     show_progress = FALSE) head(geobosque) #>   anio perdida rango1 rango2 rango3 rango4 rango5 tipobosque ubigeo #> 1 2001    0.54      0      0      0      0   0.54          1 010101 #> 2 2002    0.00      0      0      0      0   0.00          1 010101 #> 3 2003    1.53      0      0      0      0   1.53          1 010101 #> 4 2004    0.00      0      0      0      0   0.00          1 010101 #> 5 2005    1.26      0      0      0      0   1.26          1 010101 #> 6 2006    1.53      0      0      0      0   1.53          1 010101 # }

what: Download Geographic Information from MIDAGRI â€” get_midagri_data
title: Download Geographic Information from MIDAGRI â€” get_midagri_data
text: function allows download latest version MIDAGRI geographic data. information can visit following page  https://siea.midagri.gob.pe/.

title: Download Geographic Information from MIDAGRI â€” get_midagri_data
code: get_midagri_data(layer = NULL, dsn = NULL, show_progress = TRUE, quiet = TRUE)

title: Download Geographic Information from MIDAGRI â€” get_midagri_data
text: layer string. Specifies layer download. Available layers detailed 'Details' section. dsn Character. output filename .shp .gpkg format. provided, temporary file created. show_progress Logical. TRUE, displays progress bar download. quiet Logical. TRUE, suppresses informational messages.

title: Download Geographic Information from MIDAGRI â€” get_midagri_data
text: `sf` object containing downloaded geographic data.

title: Download Geographic Information from MIDAGRI â€” get_midagri_data
text: Available layers : vegetation_cover: Polygons representing agricultural areas Peru, produced high-resolution satellite images (RapidEye Sentinel-2). agriculture_sector: Polygons representing new national register agricultural statistical sectors year 2024. oil_palm_areas: Polygons representing areas cultivated oil palm Peru period 2016 2020. experimental_stations: Points representing agricultural experimental stations Peru.

title: Download Geographic Information from MIDAGRI â€” get_midagri_data
code: # \donttest{ library(geoidep) library(sf) #> Linking to GEOS 3.10.2, GDAL 3.4.1, PROJ 8.2.1; sf_use_s2() is TRUE # Disable the use of S2 geometry for accurate spatial operations sf_use_s2(use_s2 = FALSE) #> Spherical geometry (s2) switched off  # Retrieve the polygon for Coronel Portillo province coronel_portillo <- get_provinces(show_progress = FALSE) |>   subset(NOMBPROV == "CORONEL PORTILLO") |>   st_transform(crs = 32718)  # Download and extract the oil palm layer for Coronel Portillo oil_palm <- get_midagri_data(   layer = "oil_palm_areas",   show_progress = FALSE ) |>   st_intersection(coronel_portillo) #> Warning: attribute variables are assumed to be spatially constant throughout all geometries  # Visualize the oil palm layer plot(st_geometry(oil_palm))  # }

code: get_midagri_link(type = NULL)

text: type string. Select one following layers; 'vegetation cover', 'agriculture sector', 'oil palm'. Defaults NULL.

title: MIDAGRI links for obtaining cartographic information â€” get_midagri_link
text: string containing URL requested file.

what: Download the available data from Sernanp â€” get_sernanp_data
title: Download the available data from Sernanp â€” get_sernanp_data
text: function allows download latest version data available sernanp geoviewer. information, can visit following web page: https://geo.sernanp.gob.pe/visorsernanp/

title: Download the available data from Sernanp â€” get_sernanp_data
code: get_sernanp_data(layer = NULL, dsn = NULL, show_progress = TRUE, quiet = FALSE)

title: Download the available data from Sernanp â€” get_sernanp_data
text: layer Select one list available layers, information please use `get_data_sources(provider = "sernanp")`. Defaults NULL. dsn Character. Output filename spatial format. missing, temporary file created. show_progress Logical. Suppress bar progress. quiet Logical. Suppress info message.

title: Download the available data from Sernanp â€” get_sernanp_data
text: sf object.

title: Download the available data from Sernanp â€” get_sernanp_data
code: # \donttest{ library(geoidep) library(sf) anp <- get_sernanp_data(layer = "zonificacion_anp" , show_progress = FALSE) #> Reading layer `file1a5bb005f55' from data source  #>   `/tmp/RtmptsGzHC/file1a5bb005f55.geojson' using driver `GeoJSON' #> Simple feature collection with 81 features and 15 fields #> Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -81.16315 ymin: -17.17388 xmax: -68.65278 ymax: -0.07370002 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 plot(st_geometry(anp))  # }
